headline: US Pulls TSMC’s Waiver for China Shipments of Chip Supplies
summary: American officials recently informed TSMC of their decision to end the Taiwanese chipmaker’s so-called validated end user, or VEU, status for its Nanjing site.  The action mirrors steps the US took to revoke VEU designations for China facilities owned by Samsung Electronics Co. and SK Hynix Inc. The waivers are set to expire in about four months.

headline: Energy Transition Today - Navigating Renewable Energy Dynamics at U.S. Power Seminar
summary: The upcoming U.S. Electric Power Industry seminar, set for October 14-15, 2025, in Houston, will provide a comprehensive overview of the dynamics and intricacies within the electric power sector, especially focusing on renewable energy and the growing complexity of ISO markets. Participants will delve into topics such as renewable project development, ISO energy auctions, and power transactions, crucial for understanding the transition to a more sustainable energy mix. The seminar aims to...

headline: Lightwave Logic (LWLG) Strengthens Advisory Board with Semiconductor Veteran Dr. Sundar Ramamurthy
summary: Lightwave Logic Inc. (NASDAQ:LWLG) is one of the must-buy penny stocks to invest in. On August 20, the company appointed Dr. Sundar Ramamurthy to its Technical Advisory Board.
